sentences.en: Dilettante watch the scene of bustle, adept guard the entrance.
sentences.cn: 外行看热闹, 内行看门道.

sentences.en: Dilettante: a philanderer who seduces the several arts and letters each in turn for another.
sentences.cn: 业余艺术爱好者——是轮流引诱文学与艺术的不专一者.

sentences.en: He is a master of that area even if he is a dilettante.
sentences.cn: 虽然他只是个业余爱好者，但却是一流的高手。

sentences.en: He tolerated the presence of an amateur, idler and dilettante and proved a perfect teacher and matchless travel companion.
sentences.cn: 他能够容忍我这个业余爱好者的浅薄与无知，当之无愧是一个好老师和一个无与伦比的好伙伴。

sentences.en: I'm too serious to be a dilettante and too much a dabbler to be a professional.
sentences.cn: 作为一个业余艺术爱好者我过于严肃认真了，而为一个专业人员我又太业余了。

sentences.en: Is the affection between and person so dilettante really?
sentences.cn: 人和人之间的情感真的这么浅薄 么 ?

sentences.en: It is also a phenomenological layers which encourage dilettante contemplation.
sentences.cn: 这也是一个鼓励业余爱好者深思的现象层。

sentences.en: They will be even more effective if the dilettante - ish applies himself.
sentences.cn: 如果小顽童罗比尼奥能更上进,他们将会更有效率.

words.tran_cn: 对艺术、科学等一知半解的；半瓶醋似的；浅薄的；业余爱好的
浅薄的；业余艺术爱好的
业余爱好者；一知半解者

trans.tran_cn: 浅薄的；业余艺术爱好的

trans.tran_en: someone who is not serious about what they are doing or does not study a subject thoroughly

trans.tran_cn: <一般贬>浅薄的涉猎者，闹着玩的人，半吊子
（在艺术、科学等方面）浅尝辄止
